newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's CNMV says trade to resume in two shares.
newsitem.headline: Spain's CNMV says trade to resume in two shares.

text.p: Spain's Stock Market Commission CNMV cancelled trading suspensions as of today for shares of Financiera y Minera and Cementos Molins.
Both groups were suspended on June 27, when Financiera y Minera said it would propose a study be conducted on a possible merger between it and Cementos Molins.
But in a mandatory disclosure, Cementos Molins said it rejected a merger study.
Financiera y Minera owns 25.34 percent of Cementos Molins.

Financiera y Minera, in a separate disclosure to the CNMV, said there were no agreements on a possible merger other than with Ciments Francais, its major shareholder, since the project was just a proposal for a study.
